description: Please contact Dr. Steven Wilhelm (wilhelm@utk.edu) for additional information regarding this protocol.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

guidelines:
A: M12 System

B: Filter cartridge (refrigerated while stored and supported by a clamp during use)

C: Sample water 

D: Retentate

E: Permeate

F: Control panel

G: Tygon tubing

components.data: Ensure that the M12 is bolted down (preferably near a sink/drain)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ensure that the M12 is bolted down (preferably near a sink/drain)

components.data: M12 Setup
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of M12 Filtration System
source_data.annotation: Make sure to put gloves on, because the cartridges are stored in acid, which can get on our hands if you're not careful.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure to put gloves on, because the cartridges are stored in acid, which can get on our hands if you're not careful.
source_data.body: Make sure to put gloves on, because the cartridges are stored in acid, which can get on our hands if you're not careful.

components.data: Use an arm clamp to hold the cartridge up-side-down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use an arm clamp to hold the cartridge up-side-down.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of M12 Filtration System
source_data.annotation: This end is indicated by having only one port for hosing to be connected, you cannot trust the writing on the cartridge as it depends on how the caps were placed on the cartridge, so you will have to visually determine this.
source_data.thread_text: This end is indicated by having only one port for hosing to be connected, you cannot trust the writing on the cartridge as it depends on how the caps were placed on the cartridge, so you will have to visually determine this.
source_data.body: This end is indicated by having only one port for hosing to be connected, you cannot trust the writing on the cartridge as it depends on how the caps were placed on the cartridge, so you will have to visually determine this.

components.data: Carefully unwrap the parafilm
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully unwrap the parafilm

components.data: Connect the sample hosing to this port
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Connect the sample hosing to this port

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration

components.data: Connect one of the pressure sensors (does not matter which one) to the pressure sensor port.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Connect one of the pressure sensors (does not matter which one) to the pressure sensor port.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of M12 Filtration System
source_data.annotation: You may want to make sure that there is fresh Teflon tape around the threads for a secured fit. and wait until the cartridge is in its final position before connecting the other end of the pressure sensor to the M12.
source_data.thread_text: You may want to make sure that there is fresh Teflon tape around the threads for a secured fit. and wait until the cartridge is in its final position before connecting the other end of the pressure sensor to the M12.
source_data.body: You may want to make sure that there is fresh Teflon tape around the threads for a secured fit. and wait until the cartridge is in its final position before connecting the other end of the pressure sensor to the M12.

components.data: Invert the cartridge to where it is right-side-up (the upper end should have two real ports), and carefully unwrap the parafilm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the cartridge to where it is right-side-up (the upper end should have two real ports), and carefully unwrap the parafilm.

components.data: First, connect the retenate hosing to the port that faces horizontally.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: First, connect the retenate hosing to the port that faces horizontally.

components.data: Next, connect the permeate hosing to the vertically facing port.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Next, connect the permeate hosing to the vertically facing port.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 9 of M12 Filtration System
source_data.annotation: The connector that screws into the top of the cartridge is essentially invaluable and cannot be broken (be very careful).
source_data.thread_text: The connector that screws into the top of the cartridge is essentially invaluable and cannot be broken (be very careful).
source_data.body: The connector that screws into the top of the cartridge is essentially invaluable and cannot be broken (be very careful).

components.data: Connect the second pressure sensor in the same manner as the first and then to connect both of the sensors to the M12, the bottom on is inlet and the top is outlet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Connect the second pressure sensor in the same manner as the first and then to connect both of the sensors to the M12, the bottom on is inlet and the top is outlet.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 10 of M12 Filtration System
source_data.annotation: The connection to the M12 can be tricky, make sure the sensors are securely in place.
source_data.thread_text: The connection to the M12 can be tricky, make sure the sensors are securely in place.
source_data.body: The connection to the M12 can be tricky, make sure the sensors are securely in place.

components.data: Run the tygon section of the sample hosing through the pump.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the tygon section of the sample hosing through the pump.

components.data: Adjust the height and position of the cartridge to remove any kinks in the hosing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adjust the height and position of the cartridge to remove any kinks in the hosing.

components.data: When you close the clamp over the tubing, take care to ensure that the tubing is in the center-most position, using the tubing covered wire to help buffer the tygon tubing and keep it from moving toward either side.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When you close the clamp over the tubing, take care to ensure that the tubing is in the center-most position, using the tubing covered wire to help buffer the tygon tubing and keep it from moving toward either side.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 15 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: The round gears on either side chew through the tygon tubing. You will need to check often that the tubing is centered and that it is in usable condition.
source_data.thread_text: The round gears on either side chew through the tygon tubing. You will need to check often that the tubing is centered and that it is in usable condition.
source_data.body: The round gears on either side chew through the tygon tubing. You will need to check often that the tubing is centered and that it is in usable condition.

components.data: Turn the M12 power on
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn the M12 power on

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 16 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: For this particular machine, the switch is located at the top of the machine.
source_data.thread_text: For this particular machine, the switch is located at the top of the machine.
source_data.body: For this particular machine, the switch is located at the top of the machine.

components.data: Push the INTERLOCK OVERRIDE button
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Push the INTERLOCK OVERRIDE button

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 18 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: Make sure the valve to force back pressure on the retentate hosing is fully open (turn counter clockwise to open, clockwise to close, you can feel the tension change as to turn the knob).
source_data.thread_text: Make sure the valve to force back pressure on the retentate hosing is fully open (turn counter clockwise to open, clockwise to close, you can feel the tension change as to turn the knob).
source_data.body: Make sure the valve to force back pressure on the retentate hosing is fully open (turn counter clockwise to open, clockwise to close, you can feel the tension change as to turn the knob).

components.data: Push CAL ZERO and push INTERLOCK OVERRIDE again
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Push CAL ZERO and push INTERLOCK OVERRIDE again

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

components.data: Push the START/STOP button
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Push the START/STOP button

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 20 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: The pump will begin working at 10% speed. Check to make sure things are working properly and that no water is leaking.
source_data.thread_text: The pump will begin working at 10% speed. Check to make sure things are working properly and that no water is leaking.
source_data.body: The pump will begin working at 10% speed. Check to make sure things are working properly and that no water is leaking.

components.data: Slowly adjust the speed using the up and down arrows. Take the speed up to 15% and then slowly adjust the retentate valve until the outlet and inlet pressure read ~10 for each.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly adjust the speed using the up and down arrows. Take the speed up to 15% and then slowly adjust the retentate valve until the outlet and inlet pressure read ~10 for each.

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

components.data: When you near the end of the Milli-Q H2O, turn the pump off by pushing the START/STOP button again. Release the pressure on the retentate hosing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When you near the end of the Milli-Q H2O, turn the pump off by pushing the START/STOP button again. Release the pressure on the retentate hosing.

components.data: Washing M12 Cartridge
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 22 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: Don't let the sample hosing run out of water. Allow 2-4 L of water to run through to flush out the acid storage solution.
source_data.thread_text: Don't let the sample hosing run out of water. Allow 2-4 L of water to run through to flush out the acid storage solution.
source_data.body: Don't let the sample hosing run out of water. Allow 2-4 L of water to run through to flush out the acid storage solution.

components.data: Empty all three hoses of water the best that you can.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Empty all three hoses of water the best that you can.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Place the sample hosing in the container of sample water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the sample hosing in the container of sample water.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 24 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: If you are filtering a natural whole water sample you should run the whole water through a GF/F and then 0.45 and 0.2 um filters prior to M12 use. Otherwise, the 30 kDa cartridge will become clogged very quickly.
source_data.thread_text: If you are filtering a natural whole water sample you should run the whole water through a GF/F and then 0.45 and 0.2 um filters prior to M12 use. Otherwise, the 30 kDa cartridge will become clogged very quickly.
source_data.body: If you are filtering a natural whole water sample you should run the whole water through a GF/F and then 0.45 and 0.2 um filters prior to M12 use. Otherwise, the 30 kDa cartridge will become clogged very quickly.

components.data: The end of the sample hosing should be marked with a red flag, make sure that you can see that red flag at the bottom of your sample container to ensure that the full sample will be pumped through and to reduce the possibility of air getting into the hosing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The end of the sample hosing should be marked with a red flag, make sure that you can see that red flag at the bottom of your sample container to ensure that the full sample will be pumped through and to reduce the possibility of air getting into the hosing.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Place the end of the retentate hosing into the sample container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the end of the retentate hosing into the sample container.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 26 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: This water will have passed through the cartridge without having been forced through the filter. Essentially, it is the same as the sample water, which is why it is fed into that container.
source_data.thread_text: This water will have passed through the cartridge without having been forced through the filter. Essentially, it is the same as the sample water, which is why it is fed into that container.
source_data.body: This water will have passed through the cartridge without having been forced through the filter. Essentially, it is the same as the sample water, which is why it is fed into that container.

components.data: Place the end of the permeate hosing into a clean container, approximately the same size as the sample container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the end of the permeate hosing into a clean container, approximately the same size as the sample container.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 27 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: It will contain the ultrafiltrate when you are finished. This water is what has been forced through the 30 kDa filter and is therefore virus "free".
source_data.thread_text: It will contain the ultrafiltrate when you are finished. This water is what has been forced through the 30 kDa filter and is therefore virus "free".
source_data.body: It will contain the ultrafiltrate when you are finished. This water is what has been forced through the 30 kDa filter and is therefore virus "free".

components.data: Turn on the pump, and check to make sure things are working properly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on the pump, and check to make sure things are working properly.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Slowly increase the speed to 25%
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly increase the speed to 25%

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Slowly adjust the backpressure (valve on the retentate hosing) until the outlet and inlet pressure read ~15-16
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly adjust the backpressure (valve on the retentate hosing) until the outlet and inlet pressure read ~15-16

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 30 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: The outlet pressure is of concern. Make sure that it does not exceed 16 or 17.
source_data.thread_text: The outlet pressure is of concern. Make sure that it does not exceed 16 or 17.
source_data.body: The outlet pressure is of concern. Make sure that it does not exceed 16 or 17.

components.data: When the level of water remaining in the sample container is slightly below what you want, turn off the pump and drain the hoses into the sample container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When the level of water remaining in the sample container is slightly below what you want, turn off the pump and drain the hoses into the sample container.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Remove the permeate hosing from the ultrafiltrate container and allow any remaining water to drain into the same container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the permeate hosing from the ultrafiltrate container and allow any remaining water to drain into the same container.

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Cover and store at 4ºC
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover and store at 4ºC

components.data: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Virus Sample Concentration and Generation of Ultrafiltrate

components.data: Remove the sample water from the M12.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the sample water from the M12.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 34 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: This is especially important if you have been working with seawater.
source_data.thread_text: This is especially important if you have been working with seawater.
source_data.body: This is especially important if you have been working with seawater.

components.data: In a similar manner to when you rinsed out the acid storage solution, rinse out the sample water with Milli-Q or RO water (about 6 L).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In a similar manner to when you rinsed out the acid storage solution, rinse out the sample water with Milli-Q or RO water (about 6 L).

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: To wash the cartridge with 0.1 NaOH, dump the NaOH pellets into another 2 L beaker with 1 L RO water and make sure they dissolve before you feed to the M12.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To wash the cartridge with 0.1 NaOH, dump the NaOH pellets into another 2 L beaker with 1 L RO water and make sure they dissolve before you feed to the M12.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Place all three hoses into the beaker of NaOH to allow the NaOH to run through the cartridge.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place all three hoses into the beaker of NaOH to allow the NaOH to run through the cartridge.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Let the washing last for 30-45 min
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the washing last for 30-45 min

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: If you will be using the M12 within a day or so, flush out the NaOH with 6 L Milli-Q water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If you will be using the M12 within a day or so, flush out the NaOH with 6 L Milli-Q water.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Stop the M12, release the backpressure, and allow the three hoses to sit in clean water until the next use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop the M12, release the backpressure, and allow the three hoses to sit in clean water until the next use.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: If you are finished with the M12, first run 4-6 L of water through the system to remove the NaOH
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If you are finished with the M12, first run 4-6 L of water through the system to remove the NaOH

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Run this solution through the cartridge in the same manner as you flushed water through it (i.e., sample hose in the acid solution with retentate and permeate leading to a waste container).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run this solution through the cartridge in the same manner as you flushed water through it (i.e., sample hose in the acid solution with retentate and permeate leading to a waste container).

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: When you are confident that the clean water has left the cartridge and the cartridge now contains the dilute acid solution, turn off the M12 without releasing the backpressure or removing the hoses from the containers.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When you are confident that the clean water has left the cartridge and the cartridge now contains the dilute acid solution, turn off the M12 without releasing the backpressure or removing the hoses from the containers.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 43 of M12 Tangential Flow Filtration
source_data.annotation: This will be when there is very little acid left in the flask.
source_data.thread_text: This will be when there is very little acid left in the flask.
source_data.body: This will be when there is very little acid left in the flask.

components.data: Disconnect the pressure sensors from the M12, but not from the cartridge.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Disconnect the pressure sensors from the M12, but not from the cartridge.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Wearing gloves, carefully disconnect the tubing from the top of the cartridge and quickly replace the closures you removed during set up.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wearing gloves, carefully disconnect the tubing from the top of the cartridge and quickly replace the closures you removed during set up.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Wrap these closures and the end of the cartridge with a generous amount of parafilm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wrap these closures and the end of the cartridge with a generous amount of parafilm.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Acting carefully to keep the end of the sample hose under the top of the acid solution, turn the cartridge up-side-down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Acting carefully to keep the end of the sample hose under the top of the acid solution, turn the cartridge up-side-down.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Again, carefully remove the tubing and pressure sensor.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Again, carefully remove the tubing and pressure sensor.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Replace the closures that were removed at setup, and generously wrap closures and the end of the cartridge with parafilm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace the closures that were removed at setup, and generously wrap closures and the end of the cartridge with parafilm.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Store the cartridge at 4ºC
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store the cartridge at 4ºC

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Tubing/hoses should be rinsed with Milli-Q H2O and dried as much as possible before being packed away.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Tubing/hoses should be rinsed with Milli-Q H2O and dried as much as possible before being packed away.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the sample hosing in fresh Milli-Q H2O and the retentate and permeate hoses into an appropriate waste container.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the sample hosing in fresh Milli-Q H2O and the retentate and permeate hoses into an appropriate waste container.

components.data: Look at the guidelines for a key of each piece related to the use of the M12 system.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Look at the guidelines for a key of each piece related to the use of the M12 system.

components.data: M12 Setup
components.name: Section

components.data: Next, run 1 L 0.05 M phosphoric acid through the system, for proper storage of the cartridge. When you are ready to store the cartridge, dilute the acid solution 10 fold.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Next, run 1 L 0.05 M phosphoric acid through the system, for proper storage of the cartridge. When you are ready to store the cartridge, dilute the acid solution 10 fold.

components.data: M12 Cleaning
components.name: Section
